Package camzup.core

Class Utils

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Utils
All Implemented Interfaces:
IUtils
public abstract class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
implements IUtils
Implements basic math utilities for single- and double-precision numbers which may serve as alternatives to Math library functions.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static interface  Utils.EasingFuncArr<T>
    A functional interface for an easing function which interpolates an an array.
    static interface  Utils.EasingFuncObject<T>
    A functional interface for an easing function which interpolates an object from an origin to a destination by a float, with a final output parameter.
    static interface  Utils.EasingFuncPrimitive<T>
    A functional interface for an easing function which interpolates a primitive data type from an origin to a destination by a float.
    static class  Utils.Lerp
    Linear interpolator for a value.
    static class  Utils.LerpCCW
    Linear interpolator for a periodic value in the counter-clockwise direction.
    static class  Utils.LerpCW
    Linear interpolator for a periodic value in the clockwise direction.
    static class  Utils.LerpFar
    Linear interpolator for a periodic value in the furthest direction.
    static class  Utils.LerpNear
    Linear interpolator for a periodic value in the nearest direction.
    static class  Utils.LerpUnclamped
    Unclamped linear interpolation for a value.
    static class  Utils.PeriodicEasing
    An abstract class to cover the easing periodic of values, such as angles and hues in HSV color space.
    static interface  Utils.QuadFunction<T,​U,​V,​W,​R>
    A functional interface for functions with four input parameters.
    static class  Utils.SmoothStep
    Eases between two values by a smooth step.
    static interface  Utils.TriFunction<T,​U,​V,​R>
    A functional interface for functions with three input parameters.

    • abs

      public static double abs​(double value)
      An alternative to the Math.abs(double) function. Relies on bit-masking to remove the sign bit.
      Parameters:
      value - the input value
      Returns:
      the absolute value

    • acos

      public static float acos​(float value)
      Returns a value in the range [0.0, π]: π, when the input is -1.0; π / 2.0, when the input is 0.0; 0.0, when the input is 1.0. Based on the algorithm at https://developer.download.nvidia.com/cg/acos.html , which in turn cites M. Abramowitz and I.A. Stegun, Eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions .
      Parameters:
      value - the input value
      Returns:
      the angle in radians
      See Also:
      Math.acos(double)

    • asin

      public static float asin​(float value)
      Returns a value in the range [-π / 2.0, π / 2.0]: -π / 2.0, when the input is -1.0; 0.0, when the input is 0.0; π / 2.0, when the input is 1.0. Based on the algorithm at https://developer.download.nvidia.com/cg/asin.html , which in turn cites M. Abramowitz and I.A. Stegun, Eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions .
      Parameters:
      value - the input value
      Returns:
      the angle in radians
      See Also:
      Math.asin(double)

    • fmod

      public static float fmod​(float a, float b)
      Applies the modulo operator (%) to the operands, which implicitly uses the formula fmod ( a, b ) := a - b trunc ( a / b ) . When the left operand is negative and the right operand is positive, the result will be negative. For periodic values, such as an angle, where the direction of change could be either clockwise or counterclockwise, use mod. If the right operand is one, use fract(a) or a - trunc(a) instead. If the right operand is zero or NaN, returns the left operand.
      Parameters:
      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the result
      See Also:
      mod(float, float), fract(float), trunc(float), Float.isNaN(float)

    • fract

      public static float fract​(float value)
      Finds the fractional portion of the input value by subtracting the value's truncation from the value, i.e., fract ( a ) := a - trunc ( a ) . Returns 1.0 if the input value is NaN. Use this instead of fmod ( a, 1.0 ) or a % 1.0.
      Parameters:
      value - the input value
      Returns:
      the fractional portion
      See Also:
      Float.isNaN(float), trunc(float)

    • hypot

      public static float hypot​(float a, float b)
      Finds the hypotenuse between two values.
      Parameters:
      a - the first value
      b - the second value
      Returns:
      the hypotenuse
      See Also:
      Math.sqrt(double)

    • hypot

      public static float hypot​(float a, float b, float c)
      Finds the hypotenuse between three values.
      Parameters:
      a - the first value
      b - the second value
      c - the third value
      Returns:
      the hypotenuse
      See Also:
      Math.sqrt(double)

    • invSqrt

      public static float invSqrt​(float value)
      Finds 1.0 divided by the square-root of a value. This is not a fast inverse square root function; it depends on Math.sqrt(double) . Returns zero when the value is zero or NaN.
      Parameters:
      value - the value
      Returns:
      the inverse square-root

    • lerp

      public static float lerp​(float origin, float dest, float step)
      Linear interpolation from the origin to the destination value by a step. If the step is less than zero, returns the origin. If the step is greater than one, returns the destination.
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin value
      dest - the destination value
      step - the step
      Returns:
      the interpolated value
      See Also:
      lerpUnclamped(float, float, float)

    • lerpUnclamped

      public static float lerpUnclamped​(float origin, float dest, float step)
      Linear interpolation from the origin to the destination value by a step. Does not check to see if the step is beyond the range [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin value
      dest - the destination value
      step - the step
      Returns:
      the interpolated value

    • map

      public static float map​(float value, float lbOrigin, float ubOrigin, float lbDest, float ubDest)
      Maps an input value from an original range to a target range. If the upper and lower bound of the original range are equal, will return the lower bound of the destination range.
      Parameters:
      value - the input value
      lbOrigin - lower bound of original range
      ubOrigin - upper bound of original range
      lbDest - lower bound of destination range
      ubDest - upper bound of destination range
      Returns:
      the mapped value

    • mod

      public static float mod​(float a, float b)
      Applies floorMod to the operands, and therefore uses the formula mod ( a, b ) := a - b * floor ( a / b ) . If the right operand is one, use a - floor(a) instead. If the right operand is zero, returns the left operand instead of throwing a java.lang.ArithmeticException for division by zero.
      Parameters:
      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the result
      See Also:
      modUnchecked(float, float)

    • mod

      public static int mod​(int a, int b)
      An alternative to Math.floorMod(int, int) . Returns a when b is zero.
      Parameters:
      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the result
      See Also:
      Math.floorMod(int, int)

    • mod1

      public static float mod1​(float value)
      Subtracts the floor of the input value from the value. Use this instead of mod(a, 1.0).
      Parameters:
      value - the input value
      Returns:
      the result
      See Also:
      mod(float, float), floor(float)

    • modDegrees

      public static float modDegrees​(float degrees)
      A specialized version of mod which shifts an angle in degrees to the range [0, 360]. Casts float input to a double, uses a constant for 1.0 / 360, then casts back to a float upon return.
      Parameters:
      degrees - the input angle
      Returns:
      the output angle

    • modRadians

      public static float modRadians​(float radians)
      A specialized version of mod which shifts an angle in radians to the range [0, τ] .
      Parameters:
      radians - the angle in radians
      Returns:
      the unsigned radians
      See Also:
      mod(float, float), IUtils.TAU_D, IUtils.ONE_TAU_D, floor(double)

    • modUnchecked

      public static float modUnchecked​(float a, float b)
      Applies floorMod to the operands, and therefore uses the formula mod ( a, b ) := a - b * floor ( a / b ) . If the right operand is one, use moda = a - floor(a) instead. Does not check if the right operand is zero.
      Parameters:
      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the result
      See Also:
      mod1(float), floor(float)

    • not

      public static int not​(float value)
      The negation of a float holding a boolean value. Given a == 1.0, !a == 0 . Given a == 0.0, !a == 1 .
      Parameters:
      value - the input value
      Returns:
      the negation
      See Also:
      bool(float)

    • not

      public static int not​(int value)
      The negation of an integer holding a boolean value. Given a == 1, !a == 0 . Given a == 0, !a == 1 .
      Parameters:
      value - the input value
      Returns:
      the negation
      See Also:
      bool(int)

    • round

      public static float round​(float value, int places)
      Rounded a value to a number of places right of the decimal point. Promotes the float to a double, rounds it, then downcasts back to a float. Note that floating (or single) precision will likely led to errors.
      Parameters:
      value - value
      places - the number of places
      Returns:
      the rounded value
      See Also:
      Math.pow(double, double), Math.round(double)

    • sign

      public static int sign​(float value)
      An alternative to the Math.signum(float) function.
      Parameters:
      value - the input value
      Returns:
      the sign
      See Also:
      Math.signum(float)

    • smootherStep

      public static float smootherStep​(float origin, float dest, float step)
      Eases between an origin and destination by a step in [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin
      dest - the destination
      step - the step
      Returns:
      the eased value

    • smoothStep

      public static float smoothStep​(float origin, float dest, float step)
      Eases between an origin and destination by a step in [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin
      dest - the destination
      step - the step
      Returns:
      the eased value

    • toBool

      public static boolean toBool​(float value)
      Converts a float to a boolean, where 0.0 and NaN are false; all other values are true.
      Parameters:
      value - the input value
      Returns:
      the boolean

    • toBool

      public static boolean toBool​(int value)
      Converts an integer to a boolean, where 0 is false; all other values are true.
      Parameters:
      value - the input value
      Returns:
      the boolean

    • toFixed

      public static java.lang.String toFixed​(float value, int places)
      A quick, dirty representation of a single-precision real number as a String to a number of places. Edge cases:
      • When the number of places is less than one, returns the String of the truncated value.
      • When the value is not a number ( Float.NaN ), returns "0.0".
      • When the value exceeds Float.MAX_VALUE, defers to Float.toString(float) .
      • When the length of the integral exceeds a limit beyond which accurate representation is unlikely, such as with scientific notation, defers to Float.toString(float) .
      Intended to serve as an alternative to String.format(String, Object...), which is very slow, and DecimalFormat, which extrapolates values beyond the last decimal place.
      Parameters:
      value - the real number
      places - the desired number of decimal places
      Returns:
      the string

    • toFloat

      public static float toFloat​(boolean bool)
      Converts a boolean value to a float, where 1.0 is true and 0.0 is false.
      Parameters:
      bool - the input boolean
      Returns:
      the float value

    • toInt

      public static int toInt​(boolean bool)
      Converts a boolean value to an integer, where 1 is true and 0 is false.
      Parameters:
      bool - the input boolean
      Returns:
      the integer value

    • trunc

      public static float trunc​(float value)
      Truncates the input value. This is an alias for explicitly casting a float to an integer, then implicitly casting the integral to a float.
      Parameters:
      value - the input value
      Returns:
      the integral

    • ubyte

      public static int ubyte​(byte a)
      Converts a signed byte in the range [-127, 128] to an unsigned byte in the range [0, 255], promoted to an int. Useful when working with colors. Defined for cross-language support with C#, which uses signed and unsigned versions of primitive data types.
      Parameters:
      a - the signed byte
      Returns:
      the unsigned byte, promoted
      See Also:
      Byte.toUnsignedInt(byte)

    • uint

      public static long uint​(int a)
      Converts a signed int in the range [-2147483648 , 2147483647] to an unsigned int in the range [0, 4294967295], promoted to a long. Useful when working with colors. Defined for cross-language support with C#, which uses signed and unsigned versions of primitive data types.
      Parameters:
      a - the signed int
      Returns:
      the unsigned int, promoted
      See Also:
      Integer.toUnsignedLong(int)

    • xor

      public static int xor​(float a, float b)
      Evaluates two floats like booleans, using the analytic definition of the exclusive or (XOR) logic gate.
      Parameters:
      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the evaluation
      See Also:
      toBool(float)

    • xor

      public static int xor​(int a, int b)
      Evaluates two integers like booleans, using the analytic definition of the exclusive or (XOR) logic gate.
      Parameters:
      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the evaluation
      See Also:
      bool(int)
